programme.title: The Flash
programme.desc: Barry Allen uses his super speed to change the past, but his attempt to save his family creates a world without superheroes. programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview-Jan 2025

programme.title: Blade Runner
programme.sub-title: Drama, Sci Fi, Crime/detective, Action, Thriller, Fantasy ║ 1982 ║ 15
programme.desc: Futuristic thriller starring Harrison Ford, Rutger Hauer and Sean Young. Los Angeles in the year 2019: police learn that four lethal androids have escaped from a space colony to find their creator on Earth. Former cop Rick Deckard, an expert in distinguishing humans from "replicants Ridley Scott - Director Harrison Ford - Rick Deckard Rutger Hauer - Roy Batty Sean Young - Rachael Edward James Olmos - Gaff M Emmet Walsh - Bryant Daryl Hannah - Pris William Sanderson - Sebastian Brion James - Leon Joe Turkel - Tyrell Joanna Cassidy - Zhora.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Musicals
programme.desc: It is time to get musical with this all-singing, all-dancing list of movies. From Wonka to La La Land, get ready to tap your feet along to the beat.

programme.title: Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom
programme.desc: Action adventure sequel starring Jason Momoa and Patrick Wilson. Life couldn't be better for Arthur Curry (aka Aquaman) now that he's the rightful ruler of Atlantis and happily married. programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Paul Walker and Vin Diesel. When illegal street racer Dominic Toretto is suspected of being the mastermind behind a series of truck hijacks, undercover police officer Brian O'Conner is sent to infiltrate his gang. But O'Conner's judgement becomes clouded when he falls in love with Toretto's sister, Mia Rob Cohen - Director Paul Walker - Brian Earl Spilner / Officer Brian O'Conner Vin Diesel - Dominic Toretto Michelle Rodriguez - Letty Jordana Brewster - Mia Toretto Rick Yune - Johnny Tran Chad Lindberg - Jesse Johnny Strong - Leon Ted Levine - Sgt Tanner Matt Schulze - Vince.

programme.title: The Beekeeper
programme.desc: An apparently unassuming man finds someone very important to him has been scammed and driven to harm. Revealed as a former operative of a powerful and clandestine organisation known as 'Beekeepers', he sets out on a brutal quest of vengeance, hunting those responsible for the incident, who have seriously underestimated how much of a threat he is. programme.title: The Amazing Spider-Man
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Andrew Garfield and Emma Stone. Peter Parker's parents disappeared when he was young, and he has been raised by his uncle and aunt. But he is socially awkward and bullied at high school. programme.title: Blue Beetle
programme.sub-title: Fantasy, Drama, Sci Fi, Action, Thriller ║ 2023 ║ 12A
programme.desc: An ancient relic of alien biotechnology known as the Scarab chooses college graduate Jaime Reyes as its symbiotic host. He is transformed into the superhero Blue Beetle, who is protected by a suit of armour. However, powerful businesswoman Victoria Kord will stop at nothing to acquire the Scarab. programme.title: I Now Pronounce You Chuck & Larry
programme.desc: Comedy starring Adam Sandler and Kevin James. When widowed New York firefighter Larry Valentine is told that he can't name his children as life assurance beneficiaries unless he remarries, he asks devoted colleague and serial womaniser Chuck to pose as his civil partner. programme.title: Game Night
programme.desc: Comedy mystery starring Jason Bateman and Rachel McAdams. programme.desc: Action spy thriller based on the 1960s TV series, starring Tom Cruise, Jon Voight and Emmanuelle Béart. programme.title: Mission: Impossible 2

programme.title: Vendetta
programme.desc: When his daughter is brutally murdered and legal justice looks unlikely, William Duncan takes the law into his own hands, setting out on a quest for retribution. programme.title: Dune: Part Two
programme.sub-title: Action, Romance, Thriller, Drama, Sci Fi, Fantasy ║ 2023 ║ 12A

programme.title: Freud's Last Session
programme.desc: Period drama starring Anthony Hopkins and Matthew Goode. As war breaks out in Europe in September 1939, ailing psychoanalyst Sigmund Freud welcomes author CS Lewis to his London home. An exchange of ideas follows, in which the two discuss parenthood, sex, combat trauma and a bugbear of Freud's: Lewis's rejection of atheism and embrace of Christianity Matt Brown - Director Anthony Hopkins - Sigmund Freud Matthew Goode - CS Lewis Liv Lisa Fries - Anna Freud Jodi Balfour - Dorothy Burlingham Jeremy Northam - Ernest Jones Orla Brady - Janie Moore.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Biopic
programme.desc: When life inspires film, the most incredible stories are told. Join us as we journey through some of our favourite biopics, from Sky Original film Lee to Goodfellas and Back to Black.

programme.title: Girl You Know It's True
programme.sub-title: Drama, Music, Arts And Culture, Musical ║ 2023 ║ 15
programme.desc: Biographical music drama starring Tijan Njie and Elan Ben Ali. In 1980s Germany, aspiring dancers Robert Pilatus and Fabrice Morvan are discovered and signed for a new musical project, dubbed Milli Vanilli, which requires them to pose as singers. programme.desc: Mystery thriller based on the bestselling novel, starring Emily Blunt and Rebecca Ferguson. programme.title: The Integrity Of Joseph Chambers

programme.title: Golda
programme.desc: In October 1973, Israeli Prime Minister Golda Meir initially refuses to act on intelligence that suggests Egypt and Syria intend to launch a co-ordinated military offensive against Israel. Eventually the attacks begin, catching Minister of Defence Moshe Dayan off guard. Meir refuses to accept his resignation and a weakened Dayan leads the Israeli response, which requires Meir to request air support from US Secretary of State, Henry Kissinger. programme.title: The King's Speech
programme.desc: Oscar-winning historical drama starring Colin Firth, Helena Bonham Carter and Geoffrey Rush. As part of his royal duties, Prince Albert is required to speak at public events, a task made all the more difficult owing to his severe stammer. The death of his father and subsequent abdication of his older brother means that "Bertie" is to be crowned king. Unconventional speech therapist Lionel Logue is enlisted to help the future George VI find his voice - and despite Logue's disregard for all things stately, the two men form an unlikely bond Tom Hooper - Director Colin Firth - \Albert\, King George Vl Helena Bonham Carter - Queen Elizabeth Geoffrey Rush - Lionel Logue Guy Pearce - \David\, Edward Vlll Michael Gambon - King George V Timothy Spall - Winston Churchill Jennifer Ehle - Myrtle Logue Derek Jacobi - Archbishop Cosmo Lang Claire Bloom - Queen Mary Anthony Andrews - Stanley Baldwin Tim Downie - Duke of Gloucester Eve Best - Wallis Simpson Freya Wilson - Princess Elizabeth Ramona Marquez - Princess Margaret.

programme.title: SuperKlaus
programme.sub-title: Drama, Animation, Children's, Comedy, Family, Fantasy ║ 2024 ║ U
programme.desc: Santa Claus is excitedly preparing for another busy festive season at the North Pole with his army of helpers, including executive assistant Leo. Action figures of the film character SuperKlaus are especially popular this year, but a blow to the head robs Santa of his memory, and he labours under the illusion that he is SuperKlaus. programme.title: Birdy
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage returns from Vietnam to find his childhood friend, Birdy (Matthew Modine) psychologically crushed by the war. Haunting drama. Contains strong language/sex. (1984)(116 mins).

programme.title: Scent Of A Woman
programme.desc: Al Pacino won an Oscar for his grandstanding turn as a blind army colonel who stands up for student Chris O'Donnell. With Philip Seymour Hoffman. (1992)(149 mins).

programme.title: Sunset Boulevard
programme.desc: Gloria Swanson is the forgotten silent movie star who hires bankrupt screenwriter William Holden to pen her comeback script. Oscar-winning drama directed by Billy Wilder. (1950)(105 mins).

programme.title: The Sugarland Express
programme.desc: Goldie Hawn busts her husband out of jail, kidnaps a cop and goes on the run in Texas. Crime drama from Steven Spielberg. Violence/flashing images/stereo sound only. (1974)(106 mins).

programme.title: The Shawshank Redemption
programme.desc: A man is thrown into the brutality of prison life when he gets two life sentences for a crime he claims he didn't commit. Drama starring Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman. (1995)(142 mins).

programme.title: Schindler's List
programme.desc: Liam Neeson stars as Oskar Schindler, who tries to save Jewish workers from the Nazis. Violence/strong language/mature themes/flashing images. (1993)(188 mins).

programme.title: Nobody's Fool
programme.desc: A stubborn man past his prime reflects on his life of strict independence and seeks more from himself. Starring Paul Newman. (1994)(110 mins).

programme.title: Airplane
programme.desc: The original and best disaster spoof has flight controller Lloyd Bridges and other idiots trying to land a doomed airliner. Leslie Nielsen co-stars. Contains sex/nudity. (1980)(85 mins).

programme.title: Airplane II
programme.desc: The cast of Airplane! return for more chaotic fun in this delirious disaster movie spoof set aboard a doomed space shuttle. Contains mature themes/sex/flashing images. (1982)(81 mins).

programme.title: Brewster's Millions
programme.desc: Can Richard Pryor spend $30m in a month without buying a thing? Sure, if it's going to net him $300m! Riches to rags comedy with John Candy. (1985)(96 mins).

programme.title: SuperKlaus
programme.sub-title: Drama, Animation, Children's, Comedy, Family, Fantasy ║ 2024 ║ U
programme.desc: Santa Claus is excitedly preparing for another busy festive season at the North Pole with his army of helpers, including executive assistant Leo. Action figures of the film character SuperKlaus are especially popular this year, but a blow to the head robs Santa of his memory, and he labours under the illusion that he is SuperKlaus. Can tech-savvy tyke Billie and a robot companion restore Santa's memory before a megalomaniacal businessman takes undeserved ownership of Yuletide? programme.title: US Open '24: Fritz v Tiafoe
programme.desc: With the Arthur Ashe stage set, one man would realise the dream of a maiden Grand Slam final, as the American pair of Taylor Fritz and Frances Tiafoe clashed in the 2024 US Open semi-final.

programme.title: US Open '24: Pegula v Muchova
programme.desc: With a memorable win over the top seed under her belt, Jessica Pegula was a win away from a first Grand Slam final appearance as the American star fought Karolina Muchova at the US Open.

programme.title: Murray v Nadal 2008
programme.desc: At the 2008 US Open, Sir Andy Murray came up against the number one seed Rafael Nadal in the men's singles semi-final at Louis Armstrong Stadium. Roger Federer would await in the final.

programme.title: Monte Carlo 2012: Nadal v Djokovic
programme.desc: Rafael Nadal won his eighth consecutive Monte-Carlo Masters, from 2005 to 2012, with victory over storied rival Novak Djokovic.

programme.title: Indian Wells Final 2013
programme.desc: Rafael Nadal re-established his positioning at the pinnacle of tennis after knee injury with 2013 victory in Indian Wells over Juan Martín del Potro.

programme.title: McEnroe v Borg 1981
programme.desc: In winning the 1981 US Open men's singles title, John McEnroe inflicted a career-ending defeat upon long-time rival Bjorn Borg, as the Swede later retired from the professional game.

programme.title: United Cup Final
programme.desc: The two top seeds at the United Cup - the United States and Poland - meet in Sydney in the final with Iga Swiatek up against Coco Gauff, while Taylor Fritz takes on Hubert Hurkacz. (05.01).

programme.title: ATP Final: Adelaide
programme.desc: Number two seed Sebastian Korda of America stands between Felix Auger-Aliassime and a sixth tour-level title for the Canadian, as the two clash in the Adelaide International final. (11.01).

programme.title: US Open '24: Sinner v Fritz
programme.desc: In the men's singles final, Jannik Sinner stands in the way of Taylor Fritz and history, as the home hope looks to end a 21-year wait for an American man to win a Grand Slam title. (08.09).

programme.title: US Open '24: Sabalenka v Pegula
programme.desc: New York's own Jessica Pegula - competing in her first Grand Slam final - takes on last year's runner-up Aryna Sabalenka, as a first-time winner of the US Open is crowned on Ashe. (07.09).

programme.title: US Open 2013: Nadal v Djokovic
programme.desc: Revisit the 2013 US Open final as Rafael Nadal overpowered Novak Djokovic to win a second Flushing Meadows title.

programme.title: US Open 2019: Nadal v Medvedev
programme.desc: Rafael Nadal won his 19th Grand Slam and fourth US Open title with victory over Daniil Medvedev in 2019 at Flushing Meadows.

programme.title: Clijsters v Wozniacki 2009
programme.desc: Capping the mother of all comebacks, Kim Clijsters wins the 2009 US Open women's singles title by defeating Caroline Wozniacki after the the birth of her daughter.

programme.title: Djokovic v Federer 2015
programme.desc: In the final of the 2015 US Open, Novak Djokovic battled past Roger Federer to secure his second title at Flushing Meadows, and a 10th Grand Slam overall for the Serb.

programme.desc: Gael Monfils becomes the second-oldest player to reach an ATP Tour final since 1990, as the 38-year-old Frenchman meets Belgian qualifier Zizou Bergs in Auckland at the ASB Classic. (11.01).

programme.desc: United Archives 10/11/94. A classic derby encounter as Brian Horton brought his team across the city to Old Trafford.

programme.title: PL: United v Ipswich 94/95
programme.desc: United Archives 4/3/95. An amazing goal-fest at the Theatre of Dreams in March 95 as Andy Cole scored five times in an historic 9-0 victory over Ipswich Town.

programme.title: PL: Nottm Forest v United 98/99
programme.desc: United Archives 6/2/99. Former United boss Ron Atkinson was hoping to get one over his old club when they visited the City Ground with Forest deep in relegation trouble.

programme.title: PL: United v Everton 99/00
programme.desc: United Archives 4/12/99. The Intercontinental Cup champions return from Japan to put five goals past Everton, with Ole Gunnar Solskjaer grabbing four of them.

programme.title: PL: United v Southampton 00/01
programme.desc: United Archives 28/10/00. United welcomed struggling Southampton looking to keep up their scintillating home form, having scored 22 goals in their opening six league contests at the Theatre of Dreams.

programme.title: PL: United v Arsenal 00/01
programme.desc: United Archives 25/2/01. United welcomed Arsenal knowing that victory would move them closer to securing a third consecutive Premiership crown.

programme.title: PL United v Southampton 01/02
programme.desc: United Archives 22/12/01. Sir Alex's side took on Southampton with the visitors looking for their first win at Old Trafford since January 1988.

programme.title: PL: United v Newcastle 02/03
programme.desc: United Archives 23/11/02. Ruud Van Nistelrooy makes the headlines in this game full of goals.

programme.title: PL: United v Newcastle 07/08
programme.desc: United Archives 12/1/08. An uneventful first half is quickly forgotten about when United put Newcastle to the sword in the final 45.

programme.title: PL: Leicester v United 03/04
programme.desc: United Archives 27/9/03. Sir Alex's side made their first ever trip to the Walkers Stadium seeking to make it eight wins in a row against the Foxes.

programme.title: PL: West Ham v United 10/11
programme.desc: United Archives 2/4/11. Wayne Rooney scores a second half hat-trick as United comeback to win at Upton Park in one of the games of the season.

programme.title: PL: United v Arsenal 11/12
programme.desc: United Archives 28/8/11. The Reds welcomed an Arsenal side who had made a slow start to the season. With the Gunners hampered by injuries and suspensions, could Sir Alex's men take advantage?

programme.title: PL: Bolton v United 11/12
programme.desc: United Archives 10/9/11. United enjoyed a stellar start to the 2011/12 season, underlined at The Reebok Stadium with a 5 star performance against Bolton.

programme.title: PL: United v Wigan 11/12
programme.desc: United Archives 26/12/11. The Reds welcomed Wigan hoping to make it a Christmas to remember by recording a fifth straight Premier League win.

programme.title: PL: United v Norwich 12/13
programme.desc: United Archives 2/3/13. Norwich were the last team to beat the Reds in the Barclays Premier League back in November. Could the Canaries pull off another shock result?

programme.title: PL: United v Aston Villa 12/13
programme.desc: United Archives 22/4/13. Defeat for Manchester City against Tottenham meant that a win would secure the Reds a historic 20th league title, could they see off Aston Villa?

programme.title: Top 20 Premier League Goals v Liverpool
programme.desc: . United's greatest Premier League goals against Liverpool.

programme.title: All The Goals: Cole
programme.desc: Between 1995 - 2001 Andy Cole was one of the most prolific strikers in the country, his goals helped United to glory both at home and in Europe.

programme.title: All The Goals: Ronaldo
programme.desc: Cristiano Ronaldo left an indelible mark during his first spell at Old Trafford, scoring 118 goals as he became one of the world's pre-eminent footballing talents.

programme.title: All The Goals: Van Nistelrooy
programme.desc: One of the Reds' greatest finishers, Ruud bagged 150 goals in 200 starts between 2001-2006. The stats speak for themselves, but his predatory instinct in front of goal is well worth reliving...

programme.title: All The Goals: Beckham
programme.desc: A wonderfully gifted player, David Beckham could strike a ball like no other. With pin-point precision, his free-kicks were a speciality.

programme.title: All The Goals: Cantona
programme.desc: One of the most flamboyant players ever to play the game, King Eric cemented his name in United's history between 1992-97. The Frenchman helped the Reds to four league titles and two FA Cup wins.

programme.title: All The Goals: Scholes
programme.desc: He scores goals...and lots of them in a fantastic career at United. From a fox in the box to some of the best strikes you'll ever see, this man has scored them all. A true legend.

programme.title: All The Goals: Yorke
programme.desc: A passion for goals with a smile to match. From 1998-2002 Dwight impressed with a record of more than a goal every other start.

programme.title: All The Goals: Solskjaer
programme.desc: The Norwegian forward will forever be etched in United's history with the famous winning goal in 1999. His knack of being in the right place at the right time made him a huge fans' favourite.

programme.title: All The Goals: Berbatov
programme.desc: The Bulgarian striker oozed talent and scored some memorable goals in his 4 years at United. His strike rate measured more than a goal to every other start, an impressive achievement.

programme.title: All The Goals: Sheringham
programme.desc: Teddy was 31 when he joined the Old Trafford ranks in 1997. Blessed with a gifted footballing brain he played a pivotal role in helping the Reds secure the Treble in 1999.

programme.title: All The Goals: Saha
programme.desc: Signed from Fulham in 2004, Louis Saha helped Sir Alex's side to two Premier League titles and a Champions League crown.

programme.title: All The Goals: Chicharito
programme.desc: The Little Pea joined the Reds after impressive performances for Mexico at the World Cup in 2010. His pace and clinical finishing helped United regain the Premier League trophy in 2011.

programme.title: All The Goals: Keane
programme.desc: The archetypal Captain, Roy was simply magnificent and one of the best midfielders of his generation. The Irish star grabbed many an important goal in his 13 years at Old Trafford.

programme.title: All The Goals: Hughes
programme.desc: Both a great goalscorer and a scorer of great goals, Mark Hughes netted plenty of spectacular goals in his two spells at Old Trafford.

programme.title: All The Goals: Van Persie
programme.desc: One of Sir Alex's finest signings, Robin van Persie helped secure a historic 20th league title for the Reds. Relive all 58 of his United goals, including his stunning strike against Aston Villa.
